rComments: I didn't really get most of what he said about anything tbh, it was really my TA that saved me in this course. He's a bit too fast with explanations, assumes people get it, but overall a cool prof. He answers questions well and tries to keep the class engaged even though lectures are a bit long.

He got easily distracted in lecture. Additionally, when he ran out of lecture material, he would try to stretch his last slide out for like half-an-hour, and then complained when the class seemed bored. He was a really friendly guy though.

LIN102 is a good bird course. A good % of your grade comes from simple things like participation with i-clickers, completing homework and attending quizzes. His lectures are a waste of time, but you have to attend 7/11 to get the clicker marks. Read the textbook, do the homework and attend tutorials. Easy A if you do all of those. Would take again.

LOVE HIM.  He's a bit intimidating because if you don't do your work or if you slack off in the course, he will let you know, but at the same time he's quite funny and passionate about what he teaches.  He communicates with his students, and if you email him, he replies back right away. Attend class because not everything is in the lecture notes.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Caring', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: He's an offbeat, funny professor who is obviously passionate about linguistics. I enjoyed his lectures and his assessment for the course is very fair. The TA you have is very important though, as the tutorial is the only place you can get help and get practice for the tests. Use the textbook only as a adjunct, b/c he doesn't follow it that closely.

He's so sweet and he cracks little jokes. I really appreciate his teaching and his persistence for everyone to understand. I like linguistics and he just made the course a lot better. However, sometimes his explanations could be a bit better. Thank goodness for my TA because she clears everything up when parts of his lectures are confusing.
He's nice and funny. Pretty easy but can be confusing at times. Helpful. I'd recommend his linguistics classes.
Great professor. Loved his class. Very clear, amazing use of examples. I was able to grasp everything the first time around. I don't think I would have been able to if it weren't for him.
He truly loves linguistics and he's actually pretty funny. Professor K is the bomb.
